svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
September 9, 2023" date: "2023-09-09"
Eth News and Links
Dencun (Cancun + Deneb) upgrade
* Latest all core devs â€“ consensus (ACDC) call video . Notes from Christine Kim :
Testing continues on devnet-8 Devnet-9 planned for Tuesday September 19 EIP4844 blobs
per block: big block analysis presented, no changes to 3/6 (target/max) yet Proposed
addition to Dencun (open for community input): max epoch churn limit as a short term
fix to validator set size growth, discuss on ACDE whether to include in Dencun
* Testing continues on devnet-8
Testing continues on devnet-8
* Devnet-9 planned for Tuesday September 19
Devnet-9 planned for Tuesday September 19
* EIP4844 blobs per block: big block analysis presented, no changes to 3/6 (target/max)
yet
EIP4844 blobs per block: big block analysis presented, no changes to 3/6 (target/max)
* Proposed addition to Dencun (open for community input): max epoch churn limit as a
short term fix to validator set size growth, discuss on ACDE whether to include in
Dencun
Proposed addition to Dencun (open for community input): max epoch churn limit as a
Centralization watch: threatening the value of your ETH
* ðŸš¨ Lido at 32.4% is very close to breaching risky 33% threshold
ðŸš¨ Lido at 32.4% is very close to breaching risky 33% threshold
* Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ): Execution layer: Geth supermajority,
could possibly cause a chain split Consensus layer: Prysm & Lighthouse over 33%, a bug
could mean loss of finality
Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ):
* Execution layer: Geth supermajority, could possibly cause a chain split
Execution layer: Geth supermajority, could possibly cause a chain split
* Consensus layer: Prysm & Lighthouse over 33%, a bug could mean loss of finality
Consensus layer: Prysm & Lighthouse over 33%, a bug could mean loss of finality
* Need more geographic diversity for both stakers and nodes , particularly outside of
US/Can/EU
Need more geographic diversity for both stakers and nodes , particularly outside of
Layer 1
* Mempool dumpster : exports transactions from EL node transaction pools in Parquet &
CSV format
Mempool dumpster : exports transactions from EL node transaction pools in Parquet & CSV
format
* MEV-Boost: Strong builder identity : proposal to combat imposter attacks (Titan had
an imposter) Prestwich: proposers & builders could collude on gas limit to minimize
base fees
MEV-Boost:
* Strong builder identity : proposal to combat imposter attacks (Titan had an imposter)
Strong builder identity : proposal to combat imposter attacks (Titan had an imposter)
* Prestwich: proposers & builders could collude on gas limit to minimize base fees
Prestwich: proposers & builders could collude on gas limit to minimize base fees
* Whisk devnet : proof of concept Single Secret Leader Election (SSLE) on fork of
Lighthouse + Geth
Whisk devnet : proof of concept Single Secret Leader Election (SSLE) on fork of
For Stakers
* Staking directory : adds info for liquid staking on network share & self-limit
pledges
Client releases for HoleÅ¡ky testnet
* Consensus layer: Lighthouse v4.4.1 Lodestar v1.11.1 Teku v23.9.0
Consensus layer:
* Lighthouse v4.4.1
Lighthouse v4.4.1
* Lodestar v1.11.1
Lodestar v1.11.1
* Teku v23.9.0
Teku v23.9.0
* Execution layer: Besu v23.7.2 Erigon v2.49.0 Otterscan v2.0.0 alpha : adds in-node
token indexers
Execution layer:
* Besu v23.7.2
Besu v23.7.2
* Erigon v2.49.0 Otterscan v2.0.0 alpha : adds in-node token indexers
Erigon v2.49.0
* Otterscan v2.0.0 alpha : adds in-node token indexers
Research
* Terenceâ€™s EIP4844+ (ideas for extending blobs after Dencun upgrade): erase code to
increase target/max blobs to 6/12 and apply data availability sampling
Terenceâ€™s EIP4844+ (ideas for extending blobs after Dencun upgrade): erase code to
* PeerDAS : data availability sampling approach reusing p2p components to scale without
DHT
PeerDAS : data availability sampling approach reusing p2p components to scale without
* Barnabe: inclusion list games , builders may be incentivised to stuff blocks and
proposers may try to bribe/extort each other
Barnabe: inclusion list games , builders may be incentivised to stuff blocks and
Layer 2
* Base delay in block production for 45 minutes
Base delay in block production for 45 minutes
* Barry Whitehatâ€™s Plasma Free proposal: free transactions but if data is unavailable
users need to make a forced transaction (users online assumption)
Barry Whitehatâ€™s Plasma Free proposal: free transactions but if data is unavailable
EIPs/Standards
* EIPs EIP7514 : Add max epoch churn limit
EIPs
* EIP7514 : Add max epoch churn limit
* ERCs (application layer): ERC7507 : Multi-user NFT extension (ERC721 extension)
ERC7508 : Dynamic onchain token attributes repository ERC7509 : Entity component system
ERC7510 : Cross-contract hierarchical NFT (ERC721 extension) ERC7511 : Minimal proxy
contract with PUSH0 ERC7512 : Onchain representation for audits ERC7513 : NFT-bound
modularized contract (ERC1155 extension)
ERCs (application layer):
* ERC7507 : Multi-user NFT extension (ERC721 extension)
ERC7507 : Multi-user NFT extension (ERC721 extension)
* ERC7508 : Dynamic onchain token attributes repository
ERC7508 : Dynamic onchain token attributes repository
* ERC7509 : Entity component system
ERC7509 : Entity component system
* ERC7510 : Cross-contract hierarchical NFT (ERC721 extension)
ERC7510 : Cross-contract hierarchical NFT (ERC721 extension)
* ERC7511 : Minimal proxy contract with PUSH0
ERC7511 : Minimal proxy contract with PUSH0
* ERC7512 : Onchain representation for audits
ERC7512 : Onchain representation for audits
* ERC7513 : NFT-bound modularized contract (ERC1155 extension)
ERC7513 : NFT-bound modularized contract (ERC1155 extension)
Check out web3 Builders Podcast
Check out Will and Evanâ€™s interviews with the honest actors of Ethereum: Austin
Griffith , Ameen Soleimani , and Vitalik Buterin (part 1).
Or listen to our weekly news show. On this weekâ€™s episode : Lido attempting to add
backdoor onchain governance to Ethereum, Bitcoin mining adjustment and declining
security budget, and Runeâ€™s announcement of a far-off Maker appchain.
Stuff for developers
* Foundry: Forge-std v1.6.1 : new cheat codes to get keys of a mapping, filesystem
cheats & JSON parsing Catapulta (Foundry deployment automation): abstracts RPC config &
Etherscan keys, free during alpha Solpretty : Solidity library for pretty printing
numbers
Foundry:
* Forge-std v1.6.1 : new cheat codes to get keys of a mapping, filesystem cheats & JSON
parsing
Forge-std v1.6.1 : new cheat codes to get keys of a mapping, filesystem cheats & JSON
* Catapulta (Foundry deployment automation): abstracts RPC config & Etherscan keys,
free during alpha
Catapulta (Foundry deployment automation): abstracts RPC config & Etherscan keys, free
during alpha
* Solpretty : Solidity library for pretty printing numbers
Solpretty : Solidity library for pretty printing numbers
* RareSkills: gas optimization guide
RareSkills: gas optimization guide
* Guide to Vyper compilation pipeline
Guide to Vyper compilation pipeline
* Ape-roll : weiroll (operation-chaining/scripting language) client for Ape Framework
Ape-roll : weiroll (operation-chaining/scripting language) client for Ape Framework
* ApeWorX cHaOSneT (beta): paid testnet service with simulated activity using bots
ApeWorX cHaOSneT (beta): paid testnet service with simulated activity using bots
* Heimdall-rs v0.5.3 : increased decoding accuracy and adds flag to help decode
transactions with non-standard byte sizes
Heimdall-rs v0.5.3 : increased decoding accuracy and adds flag to help decode
* Privacy playgrounds (wiki): hidden information mechanics for onchain games
Privacy playgrounds (wiki): hidden information mechanics for onchain games
Security
* Stake (gambling) $41 million stolen from mainnet & sidechain hot wallets; FBI blames
Lazarus
Stake (gambling) $41 million stolen from mainnet & sidechain hot wallets; FBI blames
* GMBL Computer on Arbitrum ~$1 million exploit via referral system
GMBL Computer on Arbitrum ~$1 million exploit via referral system
* FloorDAO 40 ETH exploit via backlog of rebases
FloorDAO 40 ETH exploit via backlog of rebases
Ecosystem
* Paper on privacy pools (authors include Vitalik & Ameen Soleimani): users can prove
regulatory compliance without revealing their entire transaction history
Paper on privacy pools (authors include Vitalik & Ameen Soleimani): users can prove
* ERC4337 (account abstraction) grant recipients
ERC4337 (account abstraction) grant recipients
* Hackathon projects: ETHWarsaw and Ethcon Korea
Hackathon projects: ETHWarsaw and Ethcon Korea
Onchain stats
* Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 7.8 to 88.9 gwei, with 15.7 gwei average Negative
issuance currently at 20.4 gwei 3.6k ETH net issuance this week
Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 7.8 to 88.9 gwei, with 15.7 gwei average
* Negative issuance currently at 20.4 gwei
Negative issuance currently at 20.4 gwei
* 3.6k ETH net issuance this week
3.6k ETH net issuance this week
* ETHUSD : $1615-1653, currently $1635
ETHUSD : $1615-1653, currently $1635
* ETHBTC : 0.0627-0.0636, currently 0.0631 (Flippening at ~0.16)
ETHBTC : 0.0627-0.0636, currently 0.0631 (Flippening at ~0.16)
Notable at app layer
* USDC native on Optimism & Base
USDC native on Optimism & Base
* Kain proposes Synthetix experiment with expansion , on Base with ETH collateral
Kain proposes Synthetix experiment with expansion , on Base with ETH collateral
* Kevin Owocki returning to Gitcoin
Kevin Owocki returning to Gitcoin
* Nouns DAO fork #0 started (fork explainer : enables 20%+ to exit their share of the
treasury together)
Nouns DAO fork #0 started (fork explainer : enables 20%+ to exit their share of the
* TryENS : create a temporary ENS subdomain, expires after 48 hours
TryENS : create a temporary ENS subdomain, expires after 48 hours
* Hashmarks : fading SVG NFTs that require refreshing using the physical sculpture
Hashmarks : fading SVG NFTs that require refreshing using the physical sculpture
* Vaults.FYI : find the best yield (with or without farming incentives) for your assets
Vaults.FYI : find the best yield (with or without farming incentives) for your assets
Job Listings
* Product Manager - L2 Blockchain Effort @ Status: All jobs
Product Manager - L2 Blockchain Effort @ Status: All jobs
* EF are hiring a Senior Operations Security Expert
EF are hiring a Senior Operations Security Expert
* ZK circuits engineer sought by EF Privacy & Scaling Explorations team
ZK circuits engineer sought by EF Privacy & Scaling Explorations team
Job listings: $600 for four issues (75 character limit).Â Questions? abcoathup at-gmail
Regulation/business/tokens
* CFTC: DeFi regulation by enforcement against Opyn (despite blocking US IP addresses),
Deridex & 0x Commissioner Mersinger dissent Commissioner Pham calls for a US regulatory
sandbox
CFTC:
* DeFi regulation by enforcement against Opyn (despite blocking US IP addresses),
Deridex & 0x Commissioner Mersinger dissent
DeFi regulation by enforcement against Opyn (despite blocking US IP addresses), Deridex
* Commissioner Mersinger dissent
* Commissioner Pham calls for a US regulatory sandbox
Commissioner Pham calls for a US regulatory sandbox
* International Organization of Securities Commissions (IOSCO) DeFi policy
recommendations
International Organization of Securities Commissions (IOSCO) DeFi policy
* IMF and FSB policies for crypto assets, warns against blanket bans
IMF and FSB policies for crypto assets, warns against blanket bans
* Ark Invest & 21Shares apply for spot Ether ETF
Ark Invest & 21Shares apply for spot Ether ETF
General
* Crypto wealth report : 22 billionaires, 182 centi-millionaires & 88,200 millionaires
Crypto wealth report : 22 billionaires, 182 centi-millionaires & 88,200 millionaires
* Googleâ€™s Threat Analysis Group warns North Korea targeting security researchers
Googleâ€™s Threat Analysis Group warns North Korea targeting security researchers
* Blastpass : iPhone zero-click exploit, update your Apple devices
Blastpass : iPhone zero-click exploit, update your Apple devices
* Proton mail vulnerability disclosed, fixed
Proton mail vulnerability disclosed, fixed
Follow @WeekinEthNews to find out what the most clicked links are. Follow @abcoathup
and @evan_van_ness to get most of the weekâ€™s news in real time.
Permalink for this weekâ€™s issue:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-september-9-2023
